tweets.text: Honored to be back @USCIS. As Director, I look forward to building back better for all those who rely on a fair, efficient, and humane immigration system to live and thrive. Join me at @USCISDirector for the latest news and updates. https://t.co/Q6pqW434Au

.@DHSgov recently reopened the comment period for the 2016 Interim Final Rule (IFR) Classification for Victims of Severe Forms of Trafficking in Persons; Eligibility for ‚Äò‚ÄòT‚Äô‚Äô Nonimmigrant Status. That comment period has now been extended through Sept. 14. https://t.co/1vSrpcyYH9

During the next two weeks, we are collaborating with @uscis to highlight information about #Tvisa & #Uvisa protections and how they help victims of #HumanTrafficking. Follow along and RT to reach your community. https://t.co/IQ0lxEWWzZ

urls.title: Report of Medical Examination and Vaccination Record
urls.description: If you are applying for adjustment status to become a lawful permanent resident, use this form to establish that you are not inadmissible to the United States on public health grounds.

tweets.text: #FilingTipFriday: Save time ‚Äì file together! We encourage you to file Form I-485 & Form I-693 together. Filing at the same time eliminates the need for us to issue a Request for Evidence (RFE) to obtain your Form I-693 & helps avoid adjudication delays. https://t.co/1qroChPXPy

urls.title: USCIS Temporarily Extending Validity Period of Form I-693
urls.description: Beginning Aug.¬†12, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration¬†Services¬†is temporarily extending the validity period for¬†Form I-693, Report of Medical Examination and Vaccination Record,¬†from¬†two¬†years to now¬†four¬†years¬†due to COVID-19-related delays in¬†processing.

tweets.text: If you are applying for an employment-based Green Card and we sent you a Request for Evidence (RFE) for your Form I-693, please respond as soon as possible so we can finalize a decision on your adjustment application. Learn more https://t.co/kHzzzL3OGL https://t.co/CX3iiRvBeY

urls.title: Report of Medical Examination and Vaccination Record
urls.description: If you are applying for adjustment status to become a lawful permanent resident, use this form to establish that you are not inadmissible to the United States on public health grounds.

tweets.text: #FilingTip: Save time ‚Äì file together! We encourage you to file Form I-485 & Form I-693 together. Filing at the same time eliminates the need for us to issue a Request for Evidence (RFE) to obtain your Form I-693 & helps avoid adjudication delays. https://t.co/1qroChPXPy
Emergencies can happen at any time, and USCIS is here to help. We offer immigration services that may help people affected by unforeseen circumstances and natural disasters.

Every day, more than 240,000 dedicated public servants carry out the #DHSMission in service to our Nation and our values. We work together as one, in close partnership with others, to more effectively secure our homeland. #WeAreDHS https://t.co/CLN8M3ncWj

Today @POTUS issued a memorandum directing @DHSgov to take appropriate measures to defer for 18 months the removal for Hong Kong residents presently in the United States.

https://t.co/sTkTFpuiDO

Did you know that men‚Äôs basketball became an Olympic sport in 1936? Since then, the U.S. has fielded 19 teams and won 15 gold medals. Then and now, immigrants and children of immigrants have helped drive the sport‚Äôs success.

On this #WorldDayAgainstTraffickinginPersons, the most helpful thing you can do for victims is learn the signs and report suspected #HumanTrafficking to these numbers if you ever see it ‚¨áÔ∏è  

Learn more about this crime: https://t.co/XFKyu61a61 https://t.co/UDWLtvysZd

The Haiti TPS registration process is open from Aug. 3, 2021 - Feb. 3, 2023. All individuals requesting TPS under this designation must file an application & have been continuously residing in the U.S. since July 29, 2021.
Today, @DHSgov posted for public inspection a Federal Register notice that provides information about how to register for Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for Haiti. https://t.co/sacYRsMLPV

Due to extraordinary & temporary conditions in Haiti that prevent individuals who are nationals of Haiti from returning safely, @DHSgov designated Haiti for Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for 18 months in May 2021. https://t.co/3YQ9o0K2UP

I am profoundly honored to welcome to the United States the first group of Afghan nationals who so admirably helped support the U.S. mission in Afghanistan.

https://t.co/Zcn3crPlQv

USCIS recently determined that additional H-1B registrations needed to be selected to reach the FY 2022 H-1B cap. On July 28, we randomly selected previously submitted electronic registrations. The filing period for selected registrations will begin on Aug. 2 & close on Nov. 3.

UPDATE: If you need to reschedule appointments for biometric services, please call our Contact Center (800-375-5283). Please don't send requests by mail. We've closed the Biometrics Processing Unit in Alexandria, VA & no longer receive mail at that location.
We‚Äôve reopened the H-2B Supplemental Cap allowing employers to file petitions for returning workers under the FY 2021 H-2B supplemental visa temporary final rule. https://t.co/izSAQJfiKQ

urls.title: Reminders for DACA Recipients and Employers that Work Authorization
urls.description: Official websites use .gov A.gov website belongs to an official government organization in the United States. Secure .gov websites use HTTPS A lock () or https:// means you‚Äô ve safely connected to the .gov website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites. On October 5, 2022, the Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals partially upheld a July 2021 district court decision finding that the original DACA program (established in 2012) was unlawful; however, the Fifth Circuit sent the case back

tweets.text:
Reminder to employers: DACA recipients with current, unexpired Employment Authorization Documents (EADs) continue to be authorized to work. 

https://t.co/PjBHNA0wuI

.@USCIS is complying with the July 16 order from the U.S. District Court in TX on Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA). DACA recipients with a valid Employment Authorization Document (EAD) including an EAD that has been automatically extended are still permitted to work.

We are excited to announce that Form I-821 is now available for online filing for certain Temporary Protected Status (TPS) applicants. It‚Äôs our priority to make forms more accessible and increase the number of forms available for online filing. Learn more: https://t.co/YNjm9wOA7Q
USCIS is proud to play an important role in implementing DACA. DACA recipients are students, military service members, essential workers, & part of our communities in every way, shape, and form.

All individuals whose DACA requests were granted prior to this decision will continue to have & be eligible to renew DACA, & to request & receive advance parole, consistent with the court‚Äôs order. USCIS will provide additional specific operational guidance in the coming days.

Pursuant to the July 16, 2021 Order issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Texas in Texas v. U.S, @DHSgov is enjoined from granting initial DACA requests. 
Full statement from USCIS Acting Director Renaud on DACA court decision: https://t.co/bw3b2xlGaD

.@DHSgov is reopening the public comment period for the 2016 Interim Final Rule (IFR) Classification for Victims of Severe Forms of Trafficking in Persons; Eligibility for ‚Äò‚ÄòT‚Äô‚Äô Nonimmigrant Status for a period of 30 days. https://t.co/ACxaqRn1PI

In an effort to better inform the Liberian community of their potential eligibility for green cards through LRIF, our community relations officers have gone the extra mile visiting local businesses to ensure community members know there is still time to apply for the program. https://t.co/DvVxP7dpRL

.@DHSgov has published a Federal Register notice extending and re-designating Yemen for Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for 18 months, from Sept. 4, 2021, through March 3, 2023. https://t.co/A3WwcfLmFS
Happening Now: President Biden participates in a naturalization ceremony to welcome citizens to our country. https://t.co/Z4E1XiaR4i

We're excited to be celebrating #IndependenceDay2021 with a naturalization ceremony @MountVernon where we will welcome 40 #NewUSCitizens. We've heard that President Washington may be on hand to congratulate our newest Americans! Here‚Äôs a look back at past ceremonies there. https://t.co/87Gjy19RnY

The excitement is building up for the 25 individuals who will become our nation‚Äôs #NewUSCitizens in Atlanta this Friday amid the #July4th weekend celebrations. #GodBlessAmerica. https://t.co/DvmrhjwtKq

Tomorrow, in honor of #IndependenceDay2021, @USCIS will welcome 25 #ServiceMembers, both active duty & reservists from the @USArmy @Marines @USAirForce & @USNationalGuard as #NewUSCitizens at the beautiful, newly renovated Stavros Niarchos Foundation Library in midtown Manhattan. https://t.co/7J1hZaTdtF

An appropriate setting for 20 #ServiceMembers to become #NewUSCitizens tomorrow aboard @USSMidwayMuseum! This special naturalization ceremony is in celebration of #IndeendanceDay2021. Here‚Äôs a look back from past ceremonies at #USSMidway. https://t.co/0LipORaag0

It doesn‚Äôt get much more patriotic than an #IndependenceDay naturalization ceremony on the flight deck of aircraft carrier #USSHornet. Tomorrow we‚Äôll help welcome 60 #NewUSCitizens at this historic location. Here‚Äôs a look back at past ceremonies from @HornetMuseum. https://t.co/ExbyeLsLNb

I had the opportunity to personally thank members of the @USCIS COVID-19 Coordination Team today ‚Äî dedicated employees who stepped up to support their colleagues over the past year and a half. The only way we will get through the pandemic is by working together. https://t.co/ww5H872jFy

On Dec. 1, 2020, USCIS implemented a revised naturalization civics test (2020 civics test). The Biden administration quickly recognized the many concerns associated with this new version and promptly reverted back to the 2008 version.

An important step in becoming a #NewUSCitizen is passing the civics test. By passing the test, applicants demonstrate a basic understanding of the English language and a knowledge and understanding of civics.

We're getting ready for @USCIS' #IndependenceDay celebration with a naturalization ceremony @WWIImuseum in #NewOrleans. We'll welcome 39 #NewUSCitizens tomorrow in this stunning museum dedicated to freedom. Here‚Äôs a look back at our ceremony from 2019. https://t.co/8lOmpN0QmT

We were honored to host @USNavyCNO today aboard #OldIronsides as we celebrated the naturalization of our Sailors and fellow service members as U.S. citizens! 

Read more about it here: https://t.co/hyWXccwEjj https://t.co/LOtBtlteZs

Honored to be aboard #OldIronsides today & help take part in a naturalization ceremony for 10 new citizens (2 @USNavy Sailors, 7 @DeptofDefense other service members and 1 @USArmy veteran)!  @USSConstitution  @USCIS 


Read more üëâ https://t.co/1fcQBDg0Fl https://t.co/zNibsCUAX3

50 lucky #NewUSCitizens will have the epic @ussiowa as their backdrop on Thursday while they take the Oath Allegiance in #LA! Does it get anymore patriotic?! #4thofJuly #IndependenceDay https://t.co/xH9jGg1mvz

Centennial Village Museum in Greeley, Colo., will help welcome 20 #NewUSCitizens July 1 during a special #IndependenceDay2021 naturalization ceremony. Costumed interpreters will wander the 8 acres of beautiful grounds with 35 historical buildings. Here's a look a past ceremony. https://t.co/f5aEUcezHe

Since 2002, we've naturalized more than 139,000 U.S. #ServiceMembers, both at home and abroad. Tomorrow @SecMayorkas will join us as we add to that number and welcome 22 @USArmy soldiers and 3 #USArmy spouses as #NewUSCitizens. https://t.co/S5xGFyIpYQ

There‚Äôs no better way to kick off @USCIS‚Äô #IndependenceDay celebrations in Massachusetts than with a naturalization ceremony aboard USS Constitution. @USCIS looks forward to welcoming 10 #NewUSCitizens during tomorrow‚Äôs ceremony. Here‚Äôs a look back at our ceremony from 2019. https://t.co/kJmYam8EQ1

Imagine interviewing to become a #NewUSCitizen in a cubicle at the Oakland field office and then becoming a District Adjudications Officer and interviewing applicants in that very same cubicle! That‚Äôs the story of USCIS employee Arvind Ramakrishnan. #ImmigrantHeritageMonth https://t.co/mqt1p3eY03

.@DHS_Pride is a not-for-profit recognized by @DHSgov as an employee association for LGBTQ+ & allied employees. Since joining the Board, I've seen increased involvement from USCIS & DHS leadership in finding ways to help employees bring their full & authentic selves to work.

My name is Mary McDonough, my pronouns are she/her/hers. I am currently an Immigration Services Officer at the Vermont Service Center and I am also on the @DHS_Pride Board of Directors and serve as @DHSgov Pride Secretary. 
#Pride2021 https://t.co/XbskdNNfD0

This #WorldRefugeeDay we commit to redoubling our efforts to provide humanitarian relief for refugees & internally displaced people around the world. This day has special significance for me. I know well what it means for individuals to flee their country and to lose their home. https://t.co/r2OtiduOiF

The USCIS mission is especially important to Immigration Officer Nai Saelee. His family fled Laos in 1970 and he was born in a Thai refugee camp. Following the Fall of Saigon in 1975, the Immigration and Naturalization Service [USCIS‚Äô predecessor] oversaw their lawful admission to the U.S., cooperating with a number of federal agencies and nonprofits.

Driven by years of war, food shortages & political violence, nearly 300,000 people relocated to the U.S. from Vietnam, Cambodia & Laos in the 1970s. This picture from 1978 features a group of Vietnamese refugees as they wait for their naturalization interviews in New Orleans. https://t.co/5OSgmBJgyX

We understand the impact this has on the lives of those affected and in an effort to remove unnecessary burdens and ease the backlog we‚Äôve temporarily suspended the biometrics submission requirement for certain H-4, L-2, & E nonimmigrant applicants.

The impact of COVID-19 on our services has created an unprecedented backlog of cases related to Form I-539, which is particularly impacting H-4, L-2, and certain E nonimmigrants, and their related Form I-765, Application for Employment Authorization.

urls.title: Phony Immigration Attorney Who Filed Hundreds Of Fraudulent Asylum Applications Sentenced To More Than 20 Years In Federal Prison
urls.description: Tampa, Florida ‚Äì Senior U.S. District Judge Virginia M. Hernandez Covington today sentenced Elvis Harold Reyes (56, Brandon, Florida) to 20 years and 9 months in federal prison for mail fraud and aggravated identity theft in connection with a scheme where he posed as an immigration attorney and filed hundreds of fraudulent asylum applications. The Court deferred consideration of victim restitution to a later date.

tweets.text: Tampa man sentenced to 20+ years for filing fake asylum claims. Immigration Officers from Fraud Detection & National Security team partnered w/ @HSITampa & @USAO_MDFL to uphold the integrity of the legal immigration system & shut down this brazen scheme: https://t.co/bbrofqKDKF

It was 18 years ago that @DHSgov took its charge to protect the American people, following the urgency of 9/11. It is an honor and a privilege to serve alongside the talented, dedicated people of DHS. Thank you for all you do.

Sixty years ago, my parents brought my sister and me to the United States to build a new home for our family. Today, I am the first immigrant to serve as Secretary of Homeland Security. It is an honor, a privilege, and an awesome responsibility.
